image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Andrew Tate, brother Tristan's residences raided by Romanian Police: What we know so far
item.description: Romanian police officers carried out fresh raids at the residences of controversial influencer Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan Tate in connection with the human trafficking and rape cases against Andrew Tate. One of the world’s best-known influencers, Andrew Tate is known for spouting his misogynist and divisive ideas to his millions of followers. The Tate brothers have been accused of having formed an organized criminal network in early 2021 in Romania and Britain. They have denied the charges and a trial date has not yet been set.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bosnia high school staffer shoots dead three colleagues: police
Sweden begins brown bear hunting season with conservationists warning of a 20% drop in number
Hezbollah launches drones at military posts in Northern Israel
item.description: ​​The group released a statement on Wednesday detailing the operation, while Israel's military has not yet confirmed the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who are Kamala Harris's stepkids, Ella and Cole Emhoff
item.description: At the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Kamala Harris was joined by her stepchildren Ella and Cole Emhoff, and her husband Doug Emhoff. Harris, married to Doug since 2014, received support from her family. Barack Obama and Michelle endorsed Harris, with Obama energising the crowd and Michelle praising her qualifications for the presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine’s drone strike targets Russia's Moscow in one of the largest attacks since February 2022
item.description: Ukraine launched a substantial drone offensive on Moscow, the most significant since the beginning of the conflict in February 2022. Russian air defences intercepted 11 drones in the Moscow area, with a total of 45 drones destroyed in multiple regions. Operations at Moscow’s major airports were disrupted temporarily.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vessel off Yemen 'struck' by three projectiles: UK agency
item.description: Three projectiles hit a merchant vessel off Yemen's rebel-held port city of Hodeida on Wednesday, limiting the ship's ability to manoeuvre, British maritime security agency UKMTO said. It said there were no reports of casualties but "the vessel reports being not under command," meaning it was limited in its ability to manoeuvre, likely because of damage.

item.title: 'Trump mocks his own supporters off-camera': Stephanie Grisham slams former boss at Democratic Convention
item.description: Former Trump Press Secretary Stephanie Grisham criticized Donald Trump during the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. Grisham condemned Trump's lack of morals and his treatment of supporters. She revealed that her decision to resign was influenced by Melania Trump's refusal to denounce violence after the Capitol riots. Grisham endorsed Kamala Harris, urging GOP voters to prevent Trump's return.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Is Kamala a chameleon?': Hulk Hogan's racial jabs spark outrage as he suggests 'body-slamming' her
item.description: WWE legend Hulk Hogan, during a promotional event, made controversial remarks about US Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning her racial identity and jokingly suggesting body-slamming her. Hogan's comments attracted significant backlash, coinciding with the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where key figures showed robust support for Harris as the Democratic presidential candidate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: World's 'largest solar precinct' approved by Australian government
item.description: The Australian government's environmental approval has advanced a $19 billion solar farm project by Sun Cable, aimed at transporting electricity from northern Australia to Singapore. This project, heralded as a renewable energy milestone, faced setbacks in early 2023 but is now progressing under Grok Ventures' ownership, with energy supply expected by the early 2030s.

item.title: Deadly bus crash in Iran claims lives of 28 Pakistani Shiite pilgrims
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Obama at DNC uses hand gesture to mock Trump’s obsession with crowd sizes: 'His weird obsession with ...'
item.description: At the Democratic National Convention, former President Barack Obama critiqued Donald Trump with humor, contrasting Trump's focus on personal issues with voters' concerns. Obama highlighted Trump's obsession with crowd sizes, using a hand gesture that amused the audience, and likened Trump's behavior to a bothersome neighbor. Obama argued for a new direction with Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barack Obama at DNC: ‘Time for a new chapter with Harris, not Trump’s chaos’
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Michelle Obama: Who's going to tell Trump that the job he's seeking might be those 'black jobs'?
item.description: Michelle Obama delivered a potent speech at the DNC, criticizing former President Trump for his racially charged rhetoric and controversial comments. She praised Kamala Harris as one of the most qualified presidential candidates and called on Americans to stand up for basic freedoms and decency. Her message aimed to inspire hope amidst uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'America, hope is making a comeback': Michelle Obama at DNC
item.description: Michelle Obama made a noteworthy return to politics with a powerful speech at the Democratic National Convention. She subtly criticized former President Trump while endorsing Kamala Harris for the presidency, praising her exceptional qualifications. Michelle emphasized unity and hope, reminiscent of Barack Obama's campaigns, and energized the Democratic Party with her hopeful message.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince William’s 'irritation' revealed in latest royal dispute: Harry and Meghan’s ‘Kate’ insult hits a nerve
